Posted By: Atali (10/6/2011 12:02:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@mutantman: sorry, anything but the armpit.
  
   
@Hayw: while it's true this is two-for-one in the sense that it is [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) + [Sacred Nectar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Nectar), the Nectar part is kind of like a zero-for-one. Life gain can only provide nonzero card advantage if your opponent relies on burn spells instead of creatures or any other type of spells. So we usually think of something like Maw as a 1-for-1 land destruction spell.
posts.html:
@mutantman: sorry, anything but the armpit.

@Hayw: while it's true this is two-for-one in the sense that it is Stone Rain + Sacred Nectar, the Nectar part is kind of like a zero-for-one. Life gain can only provide nonzero card advantage if your opponent relies on burn spells instead of creatures or any other type of spells. So we usually think of something like Maw as a 1-for-1 land destruction spell.

posts.post_content: Main problem with land destruction spells is that you need cast them asap to hurt your opponent, and 5th turn is far too late. Even 4 mana LD spells don't see much play in limited. Overblown manacost and negligible upside make this card one of the worst in the set.

posts.post_content: @Tommy9898 4 cmc would SHATTER the color pie, making black better at land destruction in standard. 3 cmc would break formats AND the color pie. [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) was a busted card and red is the color of land destruction. Strapping a [Sacred Nectar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Nectar) to a [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) and giving it a mana cost of ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) would be so broken especially for black aggressive decks. Black doesn't even really do land destruction or even life gain (life drain is part of their slice of the color pie though). Not only is this card bad, it breaks the color pie by giving something that is meant for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) to mono-black. This card shouldn't even exist no less be good.
posts.html:
@Tommy9898 4 cmc would SHATTER the color pie, making black better at land destruction in standard. 3 cmc would break formats AND the color pie. Stone Rain was a busted card and red is the color of land destruction. Strapping a Sacred Nectar to a Stone Rain and giving it a mana cost of would be so broken especially for black aggressive decks. Black doesn't even really do land destruction or even life gain (life drain is part of their slice of the color pie though). Not only is this card bad, it breaks the color pie by giving something that is meant for to mono-black. This card shouldn't even exist no less be good.

posts.post_content: I know a friend who, for whatever reason, runs this card in her vampire deck. And amazingly enough, every time she draws it, she manages to use it in a way that actually allows her to win, whether it's to destroy the only mountain her opponent has, leaving him with a handful of unusable red werewolves, or it's to gain enough life to last her the one more turn she needed to win the game(those examples, by the way, actually happened).
